Posts.Content: Hi Babs I finished my treatment for IDC grade 3 and one of 15 lymph nodes were affected . Had chemo and Radiotheraphy which finished in Sept last year. Was due to have reconstruction surgery after my masectomy , and other breast removed in April. Unfortunately I had to have two teeth removed and so my surgery has been put back until June I am "gutted" to say the least. It just seems to all be taking soooo long. I am still off work, and can't face going back until I have all my surgery. I am worried about my job, and about the op and am feeling very low at the moment too . Sorry to drone on, but just wanted you to know your not alone. Good Wishes Mashley
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Hi I am having reconstruction surgery in April. I have an expander at moment, so am having this taken out an implant put in, and a masectomey and immediate implant all at the same time . sorry that all sounds a bit "Garbled"!!! Anyway I saw my dentist today who on checking my teeth says I need a Root Canal filling on one of my back lower molars. When I spoke to my surgeon a few weeks ago she mentioned infection through Root Canal fillings. I don't know now wether to just have the tooth extracted. My dentist wants to do the the treatment before my surgery. Sorry to drone on !!! Thanks A Worrier
Posts.Title: Dentist recommends a root canal filling.

Posts.Content: Hi Littlegem I don't see him again until 27th March. He is always soooo busy . I just was worried about infection and the implants being rejected, by my body. This is just what my surgeon was referring to.. I asked her about anything affecting the implants,and she mentioned infection, even Root Canal treatment. I may try to speak to her sec tomorrow. Thanks for your reply
Posts.Title: Dentist recommends a root canal filling.

Posts.Content: Hi Christina 100  I every now and again look on this forum. I was diagnosed exactly 5 years ago today. I also had Grade 3 and had node removal.  I just want to let you know that your not alone and as the  other ladies have said, this site is a “Godsend”  You are never alone with this site. Take Care x Mashley xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer stage 3

Posts.Content: Hi Marg I was due to have my op tomorrow, but because of two extractions, have had it cancelled until June. I just wondered if you had any tips I will be going home with drains in place, any advise you have would be appreciated. Hope you will be feeling much better soon Kind Regard Marg A
Posts.Title: fed up

Posts.Content: Hi Kiera I have also had a mx nearly a year ago. I have had chemo and finished rads end September. My surgeon is doing my surgery in April, which will be removal of my expander and insertion of implant, and removal of right breast with immediate reconstruction . I will be having implants, as only a three hour op compared to ten hours for a Diep. I just don't have a problem with having implants, and a shorter op and shorter recovery time. Sorry to ramble, but this is just my opinion . Love n Light Mashley
Posts.Title: Deciding whether to have reconstruction or not
